name: Autocorrelation Regularity
description: Detects periodic autocorrelation peaks that suggest resampling or AI upsampling artifacts in the image structure.
mechanism: Computes the normalized autocorrelation function over grayscale pixel rows and columns at multiple lags. Periodic peaks in the autocorrelation indicate resampling artifacts from interpolation or AI upsampling, which produce predictable periodicity absent in natural images captured directly by camera sensors.
parameters: Max lag: 32 pixels, Block size: 128x128. Sampling: row+column pairs, Normalization: zero-lag division
accuracy: Moderate — 65-78%, best combined with spectral analysis
source: Popescu & Farid (2005) — Exposing Digital Forgeries by Detecting Traces of Resampling, IEEE TSP
useCase: Detecting resampling and upsampling artifacts characteristic of AI image generation pipelines

references.title: Popescu, A.C. & Farid, H. (2005). Exposing Digital Forgeries by Detecting Traces of Resampling. IEEE TSP.
Kirchner, M. (2008). Fast and Reliable Resampling Detection by Spectral Analysis of Fixed Linear Predictor Residue. ACM MM&Sec.

strengths:
• Detects resampling artifacts invisible to human eye
• Fast computation on local pixel blocks
• Mathematical foundation in signal processing
• Complementary to spectral Nyquist analysis
limitations:
• Sensitivity drops with heavy JPEG compression
• Natural textures with periodic patterns cause false positives
• Small images may not have enough data
• Some AI models avoid resampling entirely
